Brownies

RASPBERRY SWIRL PROTEIN BROWNIES

Fudgy chocolate protein brownies with a beautiful and delicious raspberry swirl. 19g of protein.

19g
Protein
170
Calories
43m
Total Time
12
Yield
Recipe Ingredients Instructions Troubleshooting Substitutions Nutrition Panel
DOWNLOAD PDF PACK
Free Resource

GET THE PRINTABLE PACK

Includes shopping list (grams), freezer guide, and the substitution matrix PDF.

DOWNLOAD PDF PACK

INGREDIENTS

  • 120g chocolate whey protein powder
  • 60g oat flour
  • 45g unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 100g granulated sweetener
  • 1/2 tsp baking soda
  • 2 large eggs
  • 120g plain Greek yogurt
  • 100g fresh or frozen raspberries, mashed

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

1

Preheat Oven

Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.

2

Mix Brownie Batter

In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, oat flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, baking soda, eggs, and Greek yogurt until a thick batter forms.

3

Pour Batter

Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.

4

Add Raspberry Swirl

Dollop the mashed raspberries over the top of the batter. Use a knife to gently swirl the raspberries into the brownie batter.

5

Bake

Bake for 25-28 minutes, or until the center is set.

6

Cool

Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

Brownie is too dry

Try reducing baking time by 2-3 minutes, or add an extra tablespoon of Greek yogurt to the batter.

Not rising properly

Check that your baking powder is fresh (less than 6 months old). Also avoid overmixing the batter.

Gummy texture in center

This usually means under-baking. Use a toothpick to test - it should come out with just a few moist crumbs.

Too dense

Make sure you're measuring protein powder correctly. Too much protein powder can make baked goods dense.

SUBSTITUTION MATRIX

OriginalSwap WithMacro Impact
Whey ProteinCasein or Pea Protein+10% Liquid Required
Greek YogurtCottage Cheese (Blended)Higher Protein + Sodium
Oat FlourGluten-Free 1-to-1 BlendNeutral
Liquid Egg Whites2 Whole Eggs+10g Fat / +90 Cal

PRO TIPS

üí°

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

üí°

For best results, use a kitchen scale to measure ingredients in grams.

üí°

Let cool completely before storing to prevent sogginess.
